programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz travel to Stroud in Gloucestershire to take on a 1973 Hillman Imp which has been abandoned for decades. The car belongs to former NHS nurse Margaret and was her pride and joy until it started to need a lot of work to keep it on the road.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Mikes Spanish village restorations grind to a halt. George is left tackling major structural issues at his Sicilian town revival. Paul and Yip reach a momentous milestone.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George visits the ultimate in compact designer living - the Yo! Home, a futuristic living area that boasts ingenious space-saving technology, where the double bed rises from the floor and into the ceiling, to reveal the gorgeous living area.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Its full steam ahead for train driver Wayne and train manager Kate, as Lee Juggurnauth shows them the best of what their £85k budget can get them in the town of Pinar de Campoverde, Spain.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Alex and Jacqui MacPherson from Eastbourne plan to head to warmer climes to enjoy their retirement. Theyre looking for a home in the Tampa area of Florida where they can spend the winter months.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Doncaster, the first to host is glamorous insurance worker Zoe Prince. Shes cooking an Italian-themed menu, despite not being Italian and never having been to Italy. However, that might not be too much of a problem as the other guests dont seem to know their saltimbocca from their vermicelli anyway. With a tip-top menu prepared, Zoe soon learns shes got a lot more on her plate to deal with than just the food.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: After a fractious first night in Doncaster at Zoes, its now chip shop manager Martyn Bilbys turn to host. Hes pulling out all the stops with his signature dish `Swan Lake: a chocolate eclair swan on a blue jelly lake. Martyn asks his guests to dress formally, but any chance of impressing them goes out the window when Zoe and Signe spot photos of him posing for a `Mr Doncaster body building competition.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its day three and host, Trading Standards manager Tracey Hewer, divides opinion more than Marmite. However, this queen of desserts is sure that she can win over her guests with a barrage of cup cakes - for starter, main course and obviously dessert. The guests might all be going home with a dozen carefully packaged cupcakes all of their own, but by the end of the night frozen peas might be of more use.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its Latvian lecturer Signe Jases turn to host and shes decided to offer an adventurous menu of Latvian delicacies like herring salad and salted salmon, which might not have been the best idea considering the fussy competitors shes serving. If the guests can get past their first mouthful, Signes sure to put them off the rest of the dinner with some of her more eccentric ideas.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Its the final night of the competition in Doncaster, and its amusement arcade supplier Barry Hills turn to host. Hes hoping to impress his guests with a magician, a celebrity butler and even a dip in his pool. Barry shows off his cooking skills by channelling the spirit of Keith Floyd and mixing, frying and flambeing whilst swigging straight from the bottle, but its not as easy as it looks on the telly.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Diane and Gary want an accessible holiday home with a pool and space for their family to visit in sunny Paphos on Cyprus. Laura Hamilton tries to find them the perfect place for their £130k.

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: This documentary takes viewers inside the doors of Thornhill Community Academy near Dewsbury, highlighting what happens in the secondary school. Through highlighting the diverse institution, almost exactly half White British and half British-Asian, `Educating Yorkshire provides an insight into modern school life in the UK as it follows head teacher Jonny Mitchell, who tries to build upon recent improvements in exam results among the schools students. The programme also explores the universal themes of teenage life and the student-teacher relationships that are important in a young persons formative years.

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: In a star-studded episode, some famous faces are put through their musical paces in this family special! Joining Rochelle and Marvin Humes in this addictively play-along music quiz are actor Kola Bokinni and his sister DJ Yinka Bokinni, Outnumbered stars and on-screen siblings Tyger Drew-Honey and Ramona Marquez, and presenter Stacey Dooley and her partner, dancer Kevin Clifton. Who will get the chance to win £10,000 for their chosen charity?

programme.title: Tech Now

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships
programme.desc: Its a busy day at the World Athletics Championship in Tokyo, with Katarina Johnson-Thompson starting the defence of her heptathlon title with the sprint hurdles, high jump, shot put and 200m. Sarah Mulkerrins brings you all the highlights of day 7 from the National Stadium, including the men and womens 400m hurdles and 200m finals. And Keely Hodgkinson continues her quest for world gold as she goes in the semi-finals of the 800m alongside teammate Georgia Hunter Bell.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The surprising identity of Britains top-scoring footballer is revealed and things get ridiculous on Germanys version of `Historical Who Wants To Be A Millionaire. Later a Celtic farmer isnt terribly keen on plans for Hadrians Wall, and the brainy pioneers of transportation sing about their inventions.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy, Richard and James take over a gallery in Middlesbrough in a quest to prove that cars can be more popular than art - a task that proves to be more difficult than they bargained for, and meeting their set target of 30,000 visitors in just one week seems a bit ambitious. Also, Jenson Button is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. When he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months, the spark is undeniable. A handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status.

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guy is double-booked himself, so he asks Jamma to house-sit and let the builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about.

programme.title: Mindhorn
programme.desc: A has-been actor, known for playing British detective Mindhorn, works alongside the police to catch a serial killer who will only speak to Mindhorn, whom he believes to be real.

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Angie, Vince and Rosa receive unwanted Mothers Day surprises while Oly and Santi are faced with a reality they are not ready for. Bernardita masterminds a ruse to get Santi and Oly together that is cut short by a tricky encounter.

programme.title: Bump
programme.sub-title: Cant We Just Have a Few Nice Things
programme.desc: Olys white lie blows up in her face, while Bowie offers surprising insight into his parents problems. Later, Oly tries to explain to Santi why she lied, but Santi has got a new mission on his mind.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships
programme.desc: Its the penultimate day at the World Athletics Championships, and Sarah Mulkerins has highlights of all the action. Can Katarina Johnson-Thompson defend the title she won in Budapest two years ago? Its the javelin and the 800m to finish her campaign. After winning medals in all four relay finals at the Paris Olympics, Great Britain will be confident of more in Tokyo. The 4 x 400m and 4 x 100m teams will have to get through the heats first.

programme.title: Horrible Histories: The Movie - Rotten Romans
programme.desc: A smart and quick-witted Roman teenager manages to upset Emperor Nero with one of his schemes. As punishment, the teenager is sent to work in cold and wet Britain, where he also meets a tribe known as the Celts.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Gavin starts his new job in Cardiff and Stacey is thrilled to be at home again. Smithy comes to terms with life in Essex without his best mate, whilst Nessa is adjusting to life in Daves caravan down Sully. The weekend brings with it a big reunion, as everyone meets up for the christening of Neil the baby, but how will Smithy react to news from Nessa that it is a double celebration?

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Stacey is trying for a new job whilst ensuring that Gavin sticks to his recent promise, and Dave is not a happy bunny when Nessa tells him she is taking Neil the baby to Essex to see his dad. Meanwhile, over at the Shipmans house, Dawn and Pete have joined Pam and Mick for a beer and curry night of huge proportions - at the Billericay house of fun.

programme.desc: A weekly programme from the BBC World Service, bringing forensic journalism from all corners of the world. In our first episode, Nawal Al-Maghafi reports on the escalating crisis in Sudan.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A stunning Staffordshire build reaches its conclusion. Jacqui is in south east London, where an overgrown garden provides a challenge. In Greater Manchester, work has already started at a mid-terrace.

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: A widow needs help to sell her collectibles. JB finds a rare watch that could make a small fortune at auction, and Robin turns to toothpaste to help restore an antique.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey reaches the naval port of Brest, home to Frances oceanographic fleet. He also learns how to make a sweet, buttery Breton cake called kouign-amann.

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway adventure reaches Rennes, capital of Brittany.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: WA World Championship Athletics LIVE
programme.desc: Katarina Johnson-Thompson begins the defence of her world title as the womens heptathlon gets underway with the 100m hurdles. Its a busy day for the Olympic silver medallist, with the high jump, shot put and 200 metres all taking place in the single evening session out in Tokyo.

programme.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
programme.desc: Nick Robinson has a conversation with, not an interrogation of, the people who shape our political thinking about what shaped theirs.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Four chefs compete for Wales with canapes, starters and fish dishes inspired by the Olympics and Paralympics, all hoping to cook at a banquet to wish Team GB athletes luck as they head for Paris 2024.

programme.title: Worlds Sneakiest Animals
programme.desc: New science reveals bowerbirds and fiddler crabs using optical illusions to impress a female, whilst a male topi antelope fakes danger to give him an edge. Meet cross-dressing cuttlefish and marsh harriers as they sneak past dominant males to mate incognito.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The show comes from Dover Castle in Kent. Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis scour the crowd to find objects to take off to auction. Jonathan discovers an elegant Lalique figure and James finds a pristine collection of Chinese snuff bottles. Paul Martin uncovers the murderous history of Dover Castle.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Every day this week, former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

programme.title: Womens Rugby World Cup LIVE
programme.desc: Coverage of the first semi-final of the Womens Rugby World Cup 2025.

programme.title: The Newsreader
programme.desc: As Public Eye moves closer to News At Sixs reducing numbers, Dale teams up with Rob, pushing the CEO to replace Lindsay. Rob makes a controversial comment on air when discussing apartheid sports boycotts.

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. wages a historic, but dangerous, battle to secure voting rights for all, culminating in an epic march from Selma to Montgomery Alabama.

programme.title: WA World Athletics Championships LIVE
programme.desc: The penultimate day of the World Athletics Championships sees Katarina Johnson-Thompson continue the defence of her heptathlon world title with the fifth of seven events, the long jump. The mens decathlon gets underway as well with the 100 metres, long jump and shot put. Elsewhere, the final two road events take place on the streets of Tokyo as champions are crowned in the men and womens 20km walks, which both start and finish in the National Stadium.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Snake Dance; Grasshopper Chep; The Adventurers; Getting Truffy With It; Good Vibrations
programme.desc: When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilits flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Work Like a Charm; The Breathtaking Bolly Show; Whos Eating Mushton; Mush-Mush The Predictor
programme.desc: Mush-Mush and his best friends Chep and Lilit have all kinds of adventures in the forest. They are the protectors of the forest and they all have a unique power.

programme.title: Moley
programme.sub-title: Keeper for a Day; For All Molekind; Some Like it Cool; Molerskating Mayhem; Duck Moley Duck!
programme.desc: Moley helps a young mole named Cheese recognise his own talents. Mishmosh builds a tunnel digger. When Moletown experiences a heatwave, Moley and Dotty hope Mishmosh can invent something to cool things down.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wickets new expensive perfume on the floor. In an attempt to hide his crime and refill the empty bottle he tries to recreate the smell - by adding all sorts of odd and strange ingredients.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean borrows Mr Paliwals new drone to search for his stolen car. To enter a photo competition, Mr Bean deceives Irma into posing for a photoshoot.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.sub-title: Karting Bean; A Day In Bed

programme.title: Danger Mouse

programme.desc: A snake bite causes Grizzly Griller to forget all his survival know-how. Now its down to his greatest fan, Dennis, to help him re-learn his survival skills, so that they can all make it safely back to Beanotown.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: One day the kids answer the door to meet Wedgie. Shes Cheeses missing piece from the lab experiment that brought them both to life. Wedgie is happy to have finally found her family, and the kids happily take her in.

programme.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings accidentally stumble upon drawings of Tai Chi movements in a temple. They are eager to learn the moves.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is just starting to doze off one night when the Lemmings make too much noise with their crate propelled by firework rockets.

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: When a small clown gets left behind by the circus, SpongeBob takes the hapless harlequin under his wing.

programme.desc: The Odd Squad Mail Department is overrun with Pentagurps, so the Mobile Unit comes in to help before it is shut down.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Helsing should never have trusted the gang with his mindswap ray. Now Charlies a kettle, Pierce is a phone and Snorp has stolen his body!

programme.title: Danny and Mick
programme.desc: Sharons boss, Mrs Harris, has come to the leisure centre to make sure that things are running smoothly. She thinks she can run it better herself and so fires a distraught Sharon. However, it is not as easy as it looks, and Danny and Mick make sure Mrs Harris boss, Dame Frost, fires her and brings Sharon back to get things back under control.

programme.title: Bitesize: 5-7 Year Olds
programme.desc: Counting in multiples of 2, 5, and 10, calculating answers using objects, language of multiplication.

programme.title: Wow Thats Amazing
programme.desc: Get ready for incredible experiments and mind-bending puzzles to impress your friends with Wow Thats Amazing. Owain and Tilly are here to explore epic science tricks to try at home and showcase brand-new technology innovations from around the world! In this episode find out how rubber bands can make the perfect bouncy ball, meet Spot, the dancing robot dog, pick up handy tips to make art pop off the page, and try a watery trick that wont dampen your day!

programme.title: Our School
programme.sub-title: Anything I Can Do We Can Do Better
programme.desc: Our School faces a tough team adventure in the wild winter countryside. From trekking to abseiling, students and staff help each other to make it through the challenge.

programme.title: Go Get Arty
programme.desc: Go Get Arrr-ty as the Kwapongs set sail with homemade pirate ships, Sophie Ryder sculpts a huge minotaur, Bristles gives us the lowdown on mysterious street artist Banksy, and Harry Hill draws himself being chased by a very big, very blue cat!

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers celebrate some of the zoos legends and hold a special birthday party for their oldest animal, Newt the gibbon. Cam builds some new ramps for arthritic meerkat Freya.

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: The team give 11-year-old Soibi a journalism den where she can write news reports with no interruptions from her three-year-old sister.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate how lungs move, with the help of a huge water slide. And todays British Sign Language sign is `dinosaur.

programme.title: Shark Bites
programme.desc: Steve Backshall looks at gentle giant the basking shark, a huge shark found in the UK. For such a large shark, it has a somewhat surprising diet. It visits Britains coastal waters every spring and summer. Steve heads to his shark lab to reveal why.

programme.title: Danny and Mick

But between Dannys disastrously defective charity calendar, and Micks frankly frightening fancy dress, the brothers only succeed in driving the totaliser lower than when they started. Its going to take everybody putting aside their rivalries and working together as a team to turn this situation around.

Isla, Otto and Jud bake some delicious tiger ginger biscuits, using coloured icing for roar-some decorations. At playtime, Jud asks if she can play with Lucas, and they have a fun-filled game of chase. The day ends with carpet-time, and Lucas is happy with his new-found friends.

programme.desc: Aneeshwar and Lizzie meet two tapirs, Inca and Mani - a mother and her son. These incredible animals are almost like three animals in one, with a body resembling a pig, the feet of a rhino and the nose of an elephant. Next, they head into the dark to encounter another animal that loves fruit: the fruit bat, or flying fox. Hanging upside down, the flying foxes feed nearby, giving Aneeshwar and Lizzie the chance to meet these furry-faced bats.

programme.desc: Ray helps Ally obtain a Pokemon-style trading card, a `Hackidu, which is all the rage with the kids in school.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra finally cooks a dish that Ray, Robert and Frank like, but Marie is not impressed.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra plan to get more time to themselves by getting Marie and Frank to make new friends, but all does not go to plan.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: KACL has a new owner. Frasier learns that he owns 30 stations across the US, and could put Frasiers show into national syndication so begins a charm offensive with `Big Willy.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier fails to deliver Scott Bakulas autograph to the avid `Star Trek fan who is teaching him Hebrew for Fredricks Bar Mitzvah, and Daphne discovers Niles shared a night of passion with Lilith.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: After watching a focus group evaluate his show, Frasier obsesses about a newsstand owner who expressed a negative opinion.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier reflects on the years since his return to Seattle when he celebrates his third anniversary at the radio station.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA: Celebrity Edition
programme.desc: Ground-breaking model, author and body activist Ashley Graham dons a disguise to go undercover and encounter aspiring dreamers hoping to break through into the fashion world.

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, a Manchester couple finally get to grips with living and working together. In Spain, theres an emotional gathering as a Lancashire family is reunited at their cocktail bar. And wedding bells chime for a Cheshire couple in Italy.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw seek out classic cars with deserving owners. Using all their guile and restoration knowledge they sneak away clapped out classics without their owners knowing then and get the much loved motors back on the road.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with Shirley Ballas in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sarah and Ian met on holiday in Spain and now want a second home in south-east Lanzarote for themselves and their family to enjoy. Jean Johansson shows them five great properties for their budget of £90,000.

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Work at Mikes Spanish village grinds to halt, while Karen and Steve are forced to rethink their plans. And will Andrew and Katja finally be able to move into their palazzo?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment days sure to be a spicy affair this time around, with high emotions, awkward exchanges and plenty of pernickety comments to unpick.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Bolton, exuberant financial advisor Louis is hoping that his fancy fine-dining menu will shock his guests into giving him perfect tens. His posh nosh includes lamb Wellington and a dessert that bucks the weeks cheesecake trend.

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, cruise enthusiasts David and Eileen search for their dream dwelling on dry land. On the Algarve, Tristan wants to swap the Netherlands for the Portuguese sun.

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Includes sport and weather.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice
programme.desc: Natalie Cassidy and Kiell Smith-Bynoe slice into Bread Week with Jo and Tom. Whose Showstopper brought tiers of joy? And whose monkey bread was pulled apart?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britains sharpest armchair critics share more of their sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of the weeks biggest and best shows on television.

programme.title: Mitchell and Webb Are Not Helping
programme.desc: Mitchell and Webbs inventive and very sweary sketch show continues with a rubbish spy and ultra-competitive puritans. Plus: a dodgy sound-effects man, and the great taste of bran.

programme.title: American Pie: The Wedding
programme.desc: Jim and Michelle are getting married and Jim struggles to win over his future in-laws and deal with his embarrassing dad. Meanwhile, Stifler isnt invited to the ceremony, but hes determined not to be left out.

programme.title: The Kid Detective
programme.desc: A once-celebrated kid detective, now 31, continues to solve the same trivial mysteries between hangovers and bouts of self-pity. Until a naive client brings him his first `adult case, to find out who brutally murdered her boyfriend.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to Pantaleones in Denver, Colorado, where he meets the Italian restaurants owner Pete, who is truly stuck in the past. Pete stubbornly maintains that he makes the `Best Pizza in Denver, based on a review from the 1980s.

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: This documentary takes viewers inside the doors of Thornhill Community Academy near Dewsbury, highlighting what happens in the secondary school. Through highlighting the diverse institution, almost exactly half White British and half British-Asian, `Educating Yorkshire provides an insight into modern school life in the UK as it follows head teacher Jonny Mitchell, who tries to build upon recent improvements in exam results among the schools students. The programme also explores the universal themes of teenage life and the student-teacher relationships that are important in a young persons formative years.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first to host are husband-and-wife team Paul Billington and Flora Loizou from Silverwood Lodge in Cambridgeshire, the only couple in this weeks competition. As the hosts show their three female guests to their rooms, Caroline, owner of The Dean Bed and Breakfast, gives a frosty response to the fact that they dont live on site, while Sue from Seashells Guesthouse is left in hysterics.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray spends all his free time coaching his basketball team, but then realises hes missing out on time with his family.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is upset to discover that the autographed Mickey Mantle baseball his dad gave him years earlier is a fake. So he decides to tell his daughter Ally the truth about Santa.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler doesnt want new flatmate Janine to make the apartment too `girly, Ross overdoses on tooth whitener before a date, and Phoebe tells Rachel that she kissed Ralph Lauren at Rachels workplace.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Got High
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving, Chandler tries to gain favour with Monicas parents Jack and Judy, but an old secret involving Ross causes problems that he is unaware of. Meanwhile, Rachel proves she is no domestic goddess when she creates a quite disastrous dessert.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey plots the perfect opportunity to kiss Janine, while Ross and Monica resurrect their silly high school dance routine for a television special.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Apothecary Table
programme.desc: Joey is on cloud nine when he starts to date Janine, but she doesnt like his friends, and Rachel worries that Phoebe wont appreciate the way she furnishes their apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Chandler bicker over which of them created a raunchy joke, Phoebe antagonises Monica and Rachel with her candour, and Joey reluctantly takes a job at Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gets in trouble for giving female customers free food at Central Perk, and after her father cuts her off, Rachels sister Jill comes to town. Rachel talks Jill into asking Ross out, and later, Ross and Jill return to his apartment. As he closes the drapes, Rachel looks on from Monica and Chandlers apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Cant Cry
programme.desc: Chandler admits that he hasnt cried since he was a child, Phoebe discovers that Ursula is starring in porno movies using her name, and Rachel desperately tries to stop her sister Jill from starting a relationship with Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One That Could Have Been
programme.desc: Rachel tells her friends about Barry and Mindys impending divorce and wonders what life would have been like if she had married him. This leads the others to speculate how their lives could have turned out too.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One That Could Have Been
programme.desc: In the second episode showing what could have happened to the friends had their lives taken different paths, Carol and Ross decide to have a threesome to spice up their marriage, while Rachel goes to Joeys and kisses him and then catches Barry cheating.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler gets into trouble with his homemade gift for Monica, Ross tries to teach martial arts to Rachel and Phoebe, and Joey hires a look-alike.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Dates a Student
programme.desc: When a fire damages their apartment, Rachel and Phoebe must choose between living temporarily with Joey or Monica. Meanwhile, Ross gets into trouble at work, and Chandler tries to help Joeys career.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross worries when his student girlfriend Liz goes on holiday with her wild friends. Meanwhile, Rachel is desperate to find a date for a charity ball, and Joeys fridge breaks down.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.
programme.desc: Joey is excited about his audition for a major television action series about a man and his crimefighting robot, but Chandler almost ruins everything.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Meets Elizabeths Dad
programme.desc: Ross fails to impress his girlfriends father who proves tricky to get on with, and Phoebe makes Chandler and Monica paranoid by chronicling their every move in a supposedly fictional book she is writing.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Pauls the Man
programme.desc: Ross accidentally takes Elizabeth to the same cabin where Elizabeths strict father takes Rachel for a romantic vacation, and Monica panics Chandler by planning their wedding.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Since she is the only one who knows that Chandler plans to ask Monica to marry him, Phoebe helps Chandler shop for a wedding ring, while Rachels wish for Paul to reveal his emotions creates a new set of problems.

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Eve comes home for a visit and struggles to connect with her nieces; Kyle turns to Ed when he worries he isnt dynamic enough in his preaching.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra takes it upon herself to prepare the Thanksgiving dinner but, not wishing to have her turkey compared to Maries, decides to cook fish. Threatened by Debras unorthodox plan, Marie resorts to extreme culinary measures.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray spends all his free time coaching his basketball team, but then realises hes missing out on time with his family.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is upset to discover that the autographed Mickey Mantle baseball his dad gave him years earlier is a fake. So he decides to tell his daughter Ally the truth about Santa.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler doesnt want new flatmate Janine to make the apartment too `girly, Ross overdoses on tooth whitener before a date, and Phoebe tells Rachel that she kissed Ralph Lauren at Rachels workplace.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Got High
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving, Chandler tries to gain favour with Monicas parents Jack and Judy, but an old secret involving Ross causes problems that he is unaware of. Meanwhile, Rachel proves she is no domestic goddess when she creates a quite disastrous dessert.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey plots the perfect opportunity to kiss Janine, while Ross and Monica resurrect their silly high school dance routine for a television special.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Apothecary Table
programme.desc: Joey is on cloud nine when he starts to date Janine, but she doesnt like his friends, and Rachel worries that Phoebe wont appreciate the way she furnishes their apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Chandler bicker over which of them created a raunchy joke, Phoebe antagonises Monica and Rachel with her candour, and Joey reluctantly takes a job at Central Perk.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gets in trouble for giving female customers free food at Central Perk, and after her father cuts her off, Rachels sister Jill comes to town. Rachel talks Jill into asking Ross out, and later, Ross and Jill return to his apartment. As he closes the drapes, Rachel looks on from Monica and Chandlers apartment.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Cant Cry
programme.desc: Chandler admits that he hasnt cried since he was a child, Phoebe discovers that Ursula is starring in porno movies using her name, and Rachel desperately tries to stop her sister Jill from starting a relationship with Ross.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One That Could Have Been
programme.desc: Rachel tells her friends about Barry and Mindys impending divorce and wonders what life would have been like if she had married him. This leads the others to speculate how their lives could have turned out too.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One That Could Have Been
programme.desc: In the second episode showing what could have happened to the friends had their lives taken different paths, Carol and Ross decide to have a threesome to spice up their marriage, while Rachel goes to Joeys and kisses him and then catches Barry cheating.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler gets into trouble with his homemade gift for Monica, Ross tries to teach martial arts to Rachel and Phoebe, and Joey hires a look-alike.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Dates a Student
programme.desc: When a fire damages their apartment, Rachel and Phoebe must choose between living temporarily with Joey or Monica. Meanwhile, Ross gets into trouble at work, and Chandler tries to help Joeys career.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross worries when his student girlfriend Liz goes on holiday with her wild friends. Meanwhile, Rachel is desperate to find a date for a charity ball, and Joeys fridge breaks down.

programme.sub-title: The One With Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

programme.title: Friends

programme.desc: Since she is the only one who knows that Chandler plans to ask Monica to marry him, Phoebe helps Chandler shop for a wedding ring, while Rachels wish for Paul to reveal his emotions creates a new set of problems.

programme.desc: Sig must act quickly as heavy ice entombs the Northwestern. When Keiths Australian greenhorn challenges his old-school command, a culture clash erupts. Hellbent on earning an ownership stake in the Titan, Jake hauls pots at a blistering pace.

programme.title: Gold Divers

programme.title: Gold Divers

programme.title: In the Eye of the Storm
programme.desc: This series reveals recent natural disasters as they happened in real-time through footage captured by eyewitnesses who found themselves in the wrong place at the right time and boldly held up their camera phones to capture the eye of the storm.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adventurer Ed Stafford has walked the length of the Amazon River - he is the first person to accomplish that - and survived alone for 60 days on a desert island near Fiji (a feat chronicled in `Naked Castaway), so perhaps the challenges presented in `Marooned arent that daunting. Filmed in Venezuelas Gran Sabana mountains, Botswanas Okavango Delta, Romanias Carpathian Mountains, the Western Australia coast, and Borneos Brunei jungles, the five hourlong episodes see Stafford - a former British Army captain - attempt to last ten days in the harsh environments with nothing more than a camera. Viewers are provided a fly-on-the-wall perspective as Ed tries to find food, make fire, process water to drink, and build a shelter - among many other life-saving challenges.

programme.desc: Saga loses a veteran deckhand, forcing Jake to steam a greenhorn army to the Russian line. Amid scuttlebutt that ports are closing due to a virus, Josh fights to get home for a reunion with his brother and Sigs daughter gets rushed to the hospital.

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: Chronicling the rise and fall of demagogic politician Willie Stark. Stark starts out with a burning sense of purpose and a defiant honesty, but is gradually corrupted by the power he wields. Loosely based on the career of Depression-era Louisiana senator Huey Long.

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: With the pardon of notorious pirate Henry Morgan by the English King, Caribbean pirates are offered amnesty if they give up their lawless ways. As governor of Jamaica, Morgan picks Captain Jamie Waring to round up the renegade captain Billy Leech. Beautiful Margaret Denby complicates matters for Waring, as her scorn for him is matched only by his love for her.

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: Accompanied by his slave, a Roman centurion heads to Scotlands Highlands to retrieve the long-lost Ninth Legions golden eagle standard and restore his fathers honour.

programme.title: Legion
programme.desc: In a remote roadside diner in the Mojave desert, several locals including owner Bob Hanson, his son Jeep and pregnant waitress Charlie, begin to notice that something very unusual is going on. With no TV signal, all telecommunications failing, and an enormous dust cloud massing in the direction of LA, they begin to suspect a terrorist attack, but nothing can prepare them for the truth.

programme.title: Morbius

Tony visits a local bakery which doubles as an art gallery and learns to make the local oatcakes. James is inspired by the amazing local seafood and cooks up a tasty dish using plaice and lovage. Their day comes to a perfect end aboard a boat, where they spot dozens of dolphins, and James cooks up a fresh lobster and langoustine dish with an added Scottish twist.

programme.desc: Nigel Slater unravels the magic behind the combination of sugar and spice, revealing why this exotic marriage works so well in the kitchen. Alongside a classic cinnamon, ginger and plum cake, Nigel demonstrates some unexpected recipes that also have sugar and spice at their heart - such as sticky ribs, and a spicy lentil stew with caramelised onions.

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten is sharing all her secrets and pro tips for Italian dishes. She starts with a fabulous two-fer, tomato eggplant soup, and the leftovers become baked pasta with tomatoes and eggplant. Then she makes flounder Milanese topped with arugula salad and lemon vinaigrette for a modern twist on a classic. Italian ingredients shine in her kale salad with pancetta and pecorino, and finally, Ina makes a cocktail to toast all things Italian, the limoncello vodka Collins.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: James and Paul are having a blast in Northern Ireland and theyve reached Pauls home town of Belfast, where hes giving James a personal tour of Northern Irelands capital city before they head off for a spot of golf. James pitches up his mobile kitchen right on the green to whip up a tasty dish with bacon, scallops and apples with onion rings. After all his exertion on the golf course, Paul heads just out of town to Carnbrooke Meats.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: Following his French and American Adventures, James Martin explores the British culinary offerings.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.sub-title: The River Tyne; Loch Fyne; Isle of Mull; Edinburgh
programme.desc: Rick visits Loch Fyne in Scotland, and meets an award-winning haggis producer in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes
programme.desc: En route to completing his journey at John OGroats, Rick enjoys freshly cooked lobster on Crail harbour front and obtains oatmeal from a watermill in the Tay Valley to make the famous Scottish dessert Cranachan.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick travels to Bamburgh and tastes some Scotch Pies. After visiting Mike Ainsley, who farms Cheviot sheep, Rick whips up a tasty moussaka, using local lamb.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick and his dog Chalky are in the Yorkshire Dales. At Leyburn market, they check out the local dairy produce and, after chatting to the stall-holders, Rick prepares a Yorkshire curd tart.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick visits John Firth, who rears freshwater crayfish in Galloway, and cooks crayfish with pasta. He then travels to the picturesque town of Ludlow in Shropshire, which is as rich in gastronomic delights as it is in history.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick visits Cartmel in the Lake District, famous for its ancient 13th century Priory and Jean Johns sticky toffee pudding. From her village shop in this tiny pretty village, truckloads of puddings are transported daily to all parts of Britain.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick visits Cork in Southern Ireland. At the English Market, the gastronomic heart of the city, he talks to retailers and cooks corned beef and cabbage. Still in Eire, he travels up the east coast to Waterford, a town usually renowned for its glass.

programme.title: Rick Steins Food Heroes: Another Helping
programme.desc: Rick is on home turf when he visits the Tintagel area in Cornwall. Here, legend has it, the ruined castle atop the craggy, untamed cliffs is what remains of King Arthurs Camelot.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Farmhouse Roast Chicken and Creamy Prawn Linguine
programme.desc: Jamie gives traditional roast chicken a delicious French twist; shows us tasty ways to use up stale bread; and cooks his take on a creamy prawn linguine for his friend and mentor Gennaro Contaldo.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Meals for Every Day
programme.sub-title: Roast Chicken Margherita and Prawn Toast Toastie
programme.desc: Jamie reinvents a roast chicken by combining it with the flavours of a margherita pizza, then whips up some prawn toast toasties, the perfect snack for sharing.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri road trips across America to check out classic greasy spoons. With a new generation of owners and delicious homemade food, these are the kind of places that make America special.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: For four seasons fans of `Teen Mom watched Farrah, Maci, Amber and Catelynn face multiple challenges in their first years of motherhood, including such things as graduating from high school, relationships, getting jobs, beginning college and moving out on their own. Oh, and raising their first child. Now the original girls - hence, the `OG in the revived series title - return to reveal the challenges of raising children on camera, and how life in the public eye has shaped them as parents and people. Its an unprecedented view of young mothers facing the responsibilities of parenthood as their children enter kindergarten, start little league and reach other milestones of youth.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: A concerned son reaches out when his moms mysterious online boyfriend seems too shady for comfort. But Mom is hiding secrets of her own, and once Nev and Max find their man, things take a bizarre turn that leave them shocked.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: When Rod met Ebony on a dating web site four years ago, now its time for the two to meet in person. Is Ebony who she says she is?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Rico wants to move to England to care for his ailing mother, but his intense online relationship with Jamari, an international male model, is giving him second thoughts about leaving.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Nev and Max receive emails from opposite sides of the same online romance, each concerned that the other may be a catfish. The guys react in surprise when one side decides to follow through with their marriage plans.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: John is ready to leave Detroit but one thing holds him back: Kelsey. The two have never spoken outside of online chats but John is sure shes the one.

programme.title: Help! Im in a Secret Relationship!
programme.desc: Tiffany and Matt crushed on each other in high school. Today, 15 years later theyre madly in love but Tiffany feels hidden. When Matt put their sex life on pause the red flags started piling up. But Matt isnt the only one with.

programme.desc: Tipped off by the Wire, Greggs, Herc, Carver and Freamon hit the projects and intercept a drugs run. No sooner have the cops made a breakthrough than Barksdales crew make a change in their tactics.

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: A Bada Bing dancer asks Tony and Ralph for help, and Meadow turns to Noah for support.

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: Ciro wants a ceasefire, but it doesnt come without a quid pro quo. Enzo can finally enjoy all hes achieved, but the good times dont last.

programme.title: Gomorrah
programme.desc: In an unwinnable position, Genny sends Patrizia to agree terms of surrender. He and Ciro go to Enzo and hope he will listen to reason.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Hound is judged by the gods; Jaime is judged; Jon proves himself; Robb is betrayed; Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: The Hound is judged by the gods; Jaime is judged; Jon proves himself; Robb is betrayed; Tyrion learns the cost of weddings.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Jurassic
programme.desc: Welcome to a Cinema List 65 million years in the making, going through the very best moments from the Jurassic franchise - from the 1993 original to `Jurassic World: Dominion.

programme.title: Shaolin Soccer
programme.desc: A Shaolin monk-warrior who has trouble finding work, transfers his skills, and those of his fellow monks to football.

programme.title: Aquaman
programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Shazam!
programme.desc: Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: Diana, princess of the Amazons, is raised to be an unconquerable warrior on a sheltered island paradise. She discovers her full powers and true destiny after leaving home to join the fight to end all wars.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Superman
programme.desc: Portraying the early years of the man of steel, from his birth on the planet Krypton to his arrival on Earth and the first of his epic battles with the arch-criminal Lex Luthor. The superhero must prevent Luthors nefarious scheme to rearrange the west coast of America with the help of a couple of nuclear bombs.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: Having fallen in love with Lois, Superman agrees to sacrifice his powers to be with her. His last act as a superhero has an unexpected side effect, when a bomb he hurls into space to save the Eiffel Tower accidentally releases the three villains trapped in the `Phantom Zone in the first `Superman movie. The super criminals set about conquering the Earth, while Clark sits helpless.

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: Clark Kents class reunion is disrupted when a villain forces a computer genius to help destroy Superman. Based on DC Comics characters.

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: World leaders want Superman to intervene in the arms race, but he is caught in a dilemma - having vowed never to interfere in history. He eventually agrees to destroy all nuclear weapons, but then comes face to face with the android Protean Man, Lex Luthors latest evil creation. Luthor wants to stoke up the arms race, and sees the android - made from Kryptonite - as the only way to stop Superman.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after a five-year absence to find Lex Luthor ready to take over the world, and Lois Lane shacked up with a new man and a kid. The people have lost faith in their former saviour. Can Superman save their lives and regain their trust?

programme.title: Little Vampire
programme.desc: A friendship forms between a never-aging 10-year-old vampire and an orphan schoolboy, but a moon-headed monster throws obstacles in their paths.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo! The Sword and the Scoob
programme.desc: An evil sorceress transports the gang back to the age chivalrous knights, spell-casting wizards, and fire-breathing dragons.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: A feature-length spin-off from the TV series, the Thornberry family - led by natural history film-maker Colonel Radcliff Thornberry - head to deepest Africa. Once there, daughter Eliza - after meeting a shaman - can talk to the animals, a skill that stands her in good stead to foil a dastardly plot by poachers to kill a herd of elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Extinct
programme.desc: Op and Ed accidentally time-travel from the Galapagos Islands in 1835 to present-day Shanghai. They make their way through the city in confusion and make the horrifying discovery that the species to which they belong became extinct shortly after.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Concerned that his half-human grandson isnt showing his vampire side, Dracula and his friends put the boy through a `monster-in-training boot camp just as Dracs old-school father decides to pay a visit.

programme.title: Riverdance
programme.desc: An Irish boy and a Spanish girl journey into the mythical world of the Megaloceros Giganteus who teach them to appreciate Riverdance as a celebration of life.

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: A family of ducks decides to leave the safety of a New England pond for an adventurous trip to Jamaica. However, their well-laid plans quickly go awry when they get lost and wind up in New York City.

programme.title: Small Foot
programme.desc: Migo is a friendly Yeti who discovers something that he didnt know existed: a human. When his fellow villagers refuse to believe him, Migo embarks on an epic journey to find the mysterious creature that can put him back in good graces.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Mavis surprises Dracula with plans for a fun-filled summer voyage on a monster cruise. As the pack starts enjoying colossal buffets and exotic excursions, Drac finds himself falling for the ships intriguing but dangerous captain. He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the worlds most powerful vampire.

programme.title: Antz
programme.desc: Visually exuberant tale about a neurotic ant who struggles to express his individuality in a colony of conformists. He attempts to break from his totalitarian society while at the same time trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie

programme.title: Dr. Seuss the Lorax
programme.desc: A young boy searches for a way to gain the affections of his dream-girl. In his quest he learns that in order to succeed he must uncover the story of the grumpy but nature-loving Lorax.

programme.title: Straight Outta Nowhere: Scooby-Doo Meets Courage the Cowardly Dog
programme.desc: Scooby-Doo and the Gang find themselves in the middle of Nowhere, Kansas, the backwoods hometown of Courage and his owners, Muriel and Eustace Bagge.

programme.desc: A friendship forms between a never-aging 10-year-old vampire and an orphan schoolboy, but a moon-headed monster throws obstacles in their paths.

programme.desc: Batman and Robin have their hands full when Penguin, The Joker, Riddler and Catwoman join forces.

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: Two overly-imaginative pranksters accidentally hypnotise their headmaster into thinking that hes a ridiculously enthusiastic, incredibly dimwitted superhero named Captain Underpants.

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: Two overly-imaginative pranksters accidentally hypnotise their headmaster into thinking that hes a ridiculously enthusiastic, incredibly dimwitted superhero named Captain Underpants.

programme.title: Dinner for Schmucks
programme.desc: Promising business executive Tim is desperate to impress his boss and be promoted. Having secured a huge contract with a Swiss businessman, his manager invites him to an exclusive dinner party where the employee who brings along the most eccentric guest earns a trophy and the praise of the assembled executives. He finds the perfect candidate in a strange IRS employee, but things soon start to fall apart.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Saturday Night
programme.desc: To celebrate the release of the film Saturday Night, join the Cinema List as we explore 50 years of hilarious films from the SNL cast - including Waynes World, Bridesmaids and more.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: When a criminal plot endangers the beach, Mitch Buchannon leads his elite squad of lifeguards on a mission to prove that one doesnt need to wear a badge to save the bay.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Brother Ignacio is an orphanage chef who cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestling star. First, he must don a leotard.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: New student Cady Heron gets welcomed into the top of the social food chain by an elite group of popular girls called the Plastics, ruled by the conniving queen bee Regina George. However, when Cady makes the major misstep of falling for Reginas ex-boyfriend, she soon finds herself caught in their crosshairs.

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: An uncouth FBI agent goes undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant as a contestant to flush out a terrorist who plans to bomb the event. The hard-nosed cop, who prides herself on her toughness, must discard her trainers and feminise her behaviour if she is to avoid blowing her cover.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: An ordinary cabbie uses gadget-laden formal wear to combat a villain who wants to poison the worlds water supply.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop
programme.desc: A fast-talking cop trails his best friends killer from the alleys of Detroit to the posh galleries of Beverly Hills.

programme.title: Crazy Rich Asians
programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friends wedding in Singapore. Shes also surprised to learn that Nicks family is extremely wealthy and hes considered one of the countrys most eligible bachelors. Thrust into the spotlight, Rachel must now contend with jealous socialites, quirky relatives and something far, far worse: Nicks disapproving mother.

programme.title: Housesitter
programme.desc: Newton Davis builds a dream home for his childhood sweetheart and is promptly dumped. Devastated, he seeks solace in the arms of a waitress, but sneaks off into the night once hes had his fun. The spurned waitress exacts her revenge by moving into the empty house and masquerading as Newtons wife. At this stage, things start getting complicated.

programme.title: The Fighting Temptations
programme.desc: A New York executive down on his luck finds out hes been left $150,000 by his aunt Sally. Returning to his hometown in Georgia, he discovers theres a catch - he has to create a gospel choir capable of winning the Gospel Explosion competition. Recruiting the towns one decent singer, he assembles a mish-mash of singers, including local convicts, and sets about getting them into shape.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: The continuing adventures of the Portokalos family. A follow-up to the 2002 comedy, My Big Fat Greek Wedding.

programme.title: A Night at the Roxbury
programme.desc: Two sorry siblings dance their way through the Los Angeles club scene while trying to open up their own establishment.

programme.title: A Night at the Roxbury

programme.title: Rurangi
programme.desc: After leaving town 10 years prior, a transgender man reunites with his friends and family for the first time since his transition.

programme.title: Exhibiting Forgiveness
programme.desc: A Black artist finds his path to success derailed by an unexpected visit from his estranged father, a recovering addict desperate to reconcile. Together, they learn that forgetting might be harder than forgiving.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: When Death arrives on Earth to take a media tycoon to Heaven, his experiences of life as a mortal lead to him falling in love with the doomed mans daughter. Taking the form of a mysterious stranger, Death strikes a deal with the business mogul which allows each of them to spend more time on Earth, but when Deaths handsome form attracts the attention of his victims daughter, the ensuing romance is complicated for all.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Dumped and depressed, English rose Iris agrees to swap homes with similarly unlucky in love Californian Amanda for a much-needed break. Iris finds herself in a palatial Hollywood mansion while Amanda navigates the lanes of a picture-perfect English village. Soon enough, both lovelorn ladies bump into local lads perfect for a romantic pick-me-up.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Roxy Hart is sent to prison for shooting her lying lover. In prison she meets tabloid darling and headline singer, Velma Kelly, who is also in for a double murder. With the help of a slick Chicago lawyer, she learns to play the media game and vies for the valuable press attention that will get her out of jail.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: An inexperienced student begins a daring affair with a controlling businessman whose sexual proclivities push the boundaries of pain and pleasure.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: Shadowy figures from Christian Greys past threaten to destroy his rekindled romance with Anastasia Steele.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Freed
programme.desc: Believing theyve left behind the shadowy figures from the past, billionaire Christian Grey and his new wife, Anastasia, fully embrace their inextricable connection and shared life of luxury. But just as the Greys begin to step into their new roles, sinister events come to light and jeopardise their happy ending before it even begins.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Roxy Hart is sent to prison for shooting her lying lover. In prison she meets tabloid darling and headline singer, Velma Kelly, who is also in for a double murder. With the help of a slick Chicago lawyer, she learns to play the media game and vies for the valuable press attention that will get her out of jail.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Einar Wegener travels to Germany to undergo one of the first sex-change operations that took place over the course of 2 years.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: A woman on a quest to find freedom embarks upon a dramatic and life-altering journey from Mexico to Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A dark secret binds together three longtime friends who lived together at a childrens home.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: During the Yom Kippur War in 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir must navigate overwhelming odds, a sceptical cabinet, and a complex relationship with US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger as millions of lives hang in the balance.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Germany advances into France, trapping Allied troops on the beaches of Dunkirk. Under air and ground cover from British and French forces, troops are slowly and methodically evacuated from the beach using every vessel that can be found.

programme.desc: A Black artist finds his path to success derailed by an unexpected visit from his estranged father, a recovering addict desperate to reconcile. Together, they learn that forgetting might be harder than forgiving.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: When Death arrives on Earth to take a media tycoon to Heaven, his experiences of life as a mortal lead to him falling in love with the doomed mans daughter. Taking the form of a mysterious stranger, Death strikes a deal with the business mogul which allows each of them to spend more time on Earth, but when Deaths handsome form attracts the attention of his victims daughter, the ensuing romance is complicated for all.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Dumped and depressed, English rose Iris agrees to swap homes with similarly unlucky in love Californian Amanda for a much-needed break. Iris finds herself in a palatial Hollywood mansion while Amanda navigates the lanes of a picture-perfect English village. Soon enough, both lovelorn ladies bump into local lads perfect for a romantic pick-me-up.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Roxy Hart is sent to prison for shooting her lying lover. In prison she meets tabloid darling and headline singer, Velma Kelly, who is also in for a double murder. With the help of a slick Chicago lawyer, she learns to play the media game and vies for the valuable press attention that will get her out of jail.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: High-spirited musical set in 1950s America, in which a girl and boy who met on the beach are unexpectedly reunited at high school. She cannot understand how different he has become. Can the leather-clad, tough-talking leader of the T-Birds really be the same person? Perhaps her new friends, the Pink Ladies, can help her win back his heart?

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: An inexperienced student begins a daring affair with a controlling businessman whose sexual proclivities push the boundaries of pain and pleasure.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Darker
programme.desc: Shadowy figures from Christian Greys past threaten to destroy his rekindled romance with Anastasia Steele.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Freed
programme.desc: Believing theyve left behind the shadowy figures from the past, billionaire Christian Grey and his new wife, Anastasia, fully embrace their inextricable connection and shared life of luxury. But just as the Greys begin to step into their new roles, sinister events come to light and jeopardise their happy ending before it even begins.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Roxy Hart is sent to prison for shooting her lying lover. In prison she meets tabloid darling and headline singer, Velma Kelly, who is also in for a double murder. With the help of a slick Chicago lawyer, she learns to play the media game and vies for the valuable press attention that will get her out of jail.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: Ruthless silver miner, turned oil prospector, Daniel Plainview moves to oil-rich California. Using his adopted son HW to project a trustworthy, family-man image, Plainview cons local landowners into selling him their valuable properties for a pittance. However, local preacher Eli Sunday suspects Plainviews motives and intentions, starting a slow-burning feud that threatens both their lives.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Einar Wegener travels to Germany to undergo one of the first sex-change operations that took place over the course of 2 years.

programme.title: Carmen
programme.desc: A woman on a quest to find freedom embarks upon a dramatic and life-altering journey from Mexico to Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: Jamaican singer-songwriter Bob Marley overcomes adversity to become the most famous reggae musician in the world.

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: The story of British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

programme.title: Speak Like a Child
programme.desc: A dark secret binds together three longtime friends who lived together at a childrens home.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: During the Yom Kippur War in 1973, Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir must navigate overwhelming odds, a sceptical cabinet, and a complex relationship with US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger as millions of lives hang in the balance.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Germany advances into France, trapping Allied troops on the beaches of Dunkirk. Under air and ground cover from British and French forces, troops are slowly and methodically evacuated from the beach using every vessel that can be found.

programme.title: Exhibiting Forgiveness
programme.desc: A Black artist finds his path to success derailed by an unexpected visit from his estranged father, a recovering addict desperate to reconcile. Together, they learn that forgetting might be harder than forgiving.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Forced to spend Christmas break with a handful of students, a curmudgeonly instructor at a New England prep school develops an unlikely bond with a brainy troublemaker and the head cook.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Weaving in and out of the love lives of eight loosely inter-related couples. The bachelor Prime Minister falls for his personal assistant, his brother-in-law is flirting with one of his colleagues, a writer heads off to France and pursues an affair with a maid, and an 11-year-old boy asks his father for advice on matters of the heart.

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: Theres trouble brewing in Bikini Bottom. Someone has stolen King Neptunes crown, and it looks like Mr Krab, SpongeBobs boss, is the culprit. Though hes just been passed over for the promotion of his dreams, SpongeBob stands by his boss, and along with his best pal Patrick, sets out on a treacherous mission to Shell City to reclaim the crown and save Mr Krabs life.

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Now
programme.desc: In the third of the `Look Whos Talking comedies, two dogs enter the Umbriacco household - and take an immediate dislike to each other. When Molly loses her job, husband James is forced to take on a demanding role as private airline pilot. The children miss him, so he buys a dog to cheer them up. However, when Jamess glamorous boss asks his family to look after her poodle, sparks fly between the dogs.

programme.title: Friend or Foe
programme.desc: WWII evacuee David hates the Germans, but now his life has been saved by one. What is the right thing to do, tell the Army or offer his help?

programme.title: Ride On
programme.desc: Washed-up stuntman Luo seeks help from his estranged daughter and her lawyer boyfriend when his beloved stunt horse may be auctioned off to pay his debts. Luo and Red Hare become a media sensation when their fight with debt collectors goes viral.

programme.title: Wonka
programme.desc: Focusing on a young Willy Wonka and how he came to meet the Oompa-Loompas on one of his earliest adventures.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit 2
programme.desc: Despite his efforts, Peter cant seem to shake his reputation for mischief among the other rabbits. Once he adventures out of the garden Peter finds himself in a world where mischief is appreciated, but soon his family come to bring him home.

programme.title: Snow White and the Huntsman
programme.desc: In a twist to the fairy tale, the Huntsman ordered to take Snow White into the woods to be killed winds up becoming her protector and mentor in a quest to vanquish the Evil Queen.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: Two siblings set out on a mission to rescue their ex-spy parents. Summoned back to work from their uneventful lives, the adults run into trouble while on duty. When the children are called upon to help them, they find out about their parents former identities while at the same time developing a greater appreciation for each other.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Charlie Bucket comes from a poor family, and spends most of his time dreaming about the chocolate that he loves but usually cant afford. Things change when Willy Wonka, head of the very popular Wonka Chocolate empire, announces a contest in which five gold tickets have been hidden in chocolate bars. Charlie is one of the five kids who finds a lucky ticket and goes on a tour of Wonkas chocolate factory.

programme.title: Look Whos Talking
programme.desc: Mollie is a pregnant woman whose partner has deserted her. When she goes into labour, friendly taxi driver James rushes her to hospital and the pair become firm friends. He slowly falls in love with her and her baby Mikey, but shes still looking for her perfect partner, not realising hes right under her nose. However we can hear Mikeys thoughts, and he wants James as his Dad.

programme.title: Jack the Giant Slayer
programme.desc: A young farmhand gets swept into the realm of legend when he must defend his land from a seemingly unstoppable force of giant warriors.

programme.title: Look Whos Talking Now
programme.desc: In the third of the `Look Whos Talking comedies, two dogs enter the Umbriacco household - and take an immediate dislike to each other. When Molly loses her job, husband James is forced to take on a demanding role as private airline pilot. The children miss him, so he buys a dog to cheer them up. However, when Jamess glamorous boss asks his family to look after her poodle, sparks fly between the dogs.

programme.title: The Wiz
programme.desc: In this version of the classic story - based on the smash Broadway musical - Dorothy is a shy 24-year-old Harlem kindergarten teacher who is brought by a snowstorm to the mysterious Land of Oz, a sprawling, decaying, nightmarish, and dangerous megalopolis that resembles the physical characteristics of New York City.

programme.title: Nutty Professor II: The Klumps
programme.desc: Sherman is getting married to Denise Gains but his alter-ego Buddy Love keeps breaking through. Determined to rid himself of his pesky partner, he extracts Buddys genes, but an accident and a dog hair see Buddy take on his own life. Unaware of his existence, Sherman and Denise perfect their new rejuvenation formula and their fortune seems assured until Buddy steals it.
